Website builder, logo designer, plant planter.

About Wes

Hi. I use sites and logos to tell stories and have been doing so for a decade and a half. Mostly on the side these days though. My main gig is UX design for the enterprise open-source company .

To counterbalance the screened-life, I make the most of living in Vermont with my wife and two kiddos by gardening and spending time out of doors.

What I do

üå± Branding

An often overlooked but mighty piece of any site. It ensures that first the impression hits the way it's intended to.

üå≥ Web design

I help folks spruce up their online presence. My offering is not just about launching a new site, but building in systems to help you tend to it as it grows.

‚úÇÔ∏è Research

Orchards require pruning. Websites require maintenance. This means understanding how people use your site and optimizing it to make it do its job better. I specialize in heatmaps, ab testing, and remote user testing.

Work status

Currently

Red Hat: Sr. UX designer specializing in hairy, system-based projects on redhat.com like navigation. Also, ux research and ops.

Before that

iMarket Solutions: First designer at Vermont marketing startup, creating over 200 websites for home services companies. Spearheaded design ops and research initiatives.

Way before that

Brady People ID: Where I cut my teeth in graphic design. Typography, layout, and print. Fidelity: Where I leaped from print to the web developing and designing ads. ‚öîÔ∏è Freelance: Where I dove deep into web marketing with agencies and clients directly.
